content.description: This climb is the same as The Sorcerer except you use the sloper to topout right
content.location: This starts the same as The Sorcerer

content.description: From the start pull on to a quartz rail a few feet up, from there top out to the left.
content.protection: One pad for the rock behind the start
content.location: The climb starts on the really low sloper and a little (Non-quartz) sidepull foot or two left of the sloper.

content.description: This climb is similar to The Sorcerista, the difference is that on this climb you traverse to the right arete and topout directly on the corner.
content.protection: Three pads, two if you have a spotter.
content.location: The start is the same as The Sorcerer

content.description:
This often overlooked problem is a great way to test your huggy-bear meddle.   

  Begin low on the fat, blunt arete, and hug your way up using crimps, gastons, slopers, being careful not to scrape your chin on the rock directly in front of your face. 

  Finish the problem at will, as both sides yield similarly difficult exits.
content.location: To the right of the start of the Nemesis Traverse by about 100 feet is a short, squat boulder with a low, sloping roof behind and to the right of it (this roof problem, is a fun problem in and of itself.).  The start is on the right side.

pathTokens: Boulders Behind the Main Parking Lot/Visitor Center

content.description: This small, dumpy boulder holds one very frustrating problem.
